title: Live.com-style sign-in landing experience (Internet Identity)

requirements.text: Create a Live.com-inspired landing page that presents a clean, minimal sign-in entry experience with an input labeled "Email, phone, or Skype" and primary actions "Next" and "Sign-in options". The page must clearly indicate it is a demo app and must not use Microsoft trademarks, logos, or copyrighted brand assets.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders with an email/phone/Skype input and buttons labeled "Next" and "Sign-in options".
Page includes a visible disclaimer such as "Demo sign-in" and avoids Microsoft branding (no Microsoft logo, no Windows logo, no Outlook logo).
UI is responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Implement authentication using Internet Identity. Clicking "Next" on the landing page must initiate the Internet Identity login flow, and on success the UI must show a signed-in state with the user principal and a "Sign out" action.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users see the landing/sign-in entry UI.
Clicking "Next" triggers Internet Identity sign-in.
After successful sign-in, the UI displays the authenticated principal and a "Sign out" control that returns the user to the unauthenticated state.

requirements.text: Add a post-sign-in "app launcher" page modeled after the Live.com entry hub: show a grid of product tiles (e.g., Mail, Calendar, People, Files) and a top bar with a search input. Tiles can navigate to simple placeholder pages within the app (no external redirects required).
acceptanceCriteria: After signing in, user is taken to an app launcher page with a grid of at least 6 tiles and a top search input.
Each tile navigates to a corresponding placeholder route/page within the app.
Placeholder pages show the tile name and a short description (English) and provide a way to return to the launcher.

requirements.text: Persist a minimal user record in the Motoko canister keyed by principal, including createdAt and lastLogin timestamps, and expose query/call methods to fetch the current user record and update lastLogin on sign-in.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores user records keyed by caller principal with createdAt and lastLogin values.
Backend provides a method to fetch the caller’s user record.
When the frontend completes sign-in, it calls a backend method that creates the record if missing and updates lastLogin.

requirements.text: Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for: (1) fetching the signed-in user record, and (2) refreshing user state after sign-in/sign-out.
acceptanceCriteria: User record fetch is performed via React Query and reflects the current authenticated principal.
After sign-in, the UI refreshes to show user record data (at minimum lastLogin).
After sign-out, cached authenticated queries are cleared/invalidated so private UI does not remain visible.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme for the entire app that evokes a modern, airy sign-in portal (light background, crisp typography, subtle depth), without using Microsoft’s signature branding. Use a consistent color palette, spacing system, and component styles across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across landing, launcher, and placeholder pages.
No use of Microsoft-specific brand colors/logos; overall look remains clean and professional.
Buttons, inputs, cards/tiles have consistent styling and interaction states (hover/focus/disabled).

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets required for the landing/launcher UI to frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI (do not serve images via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Landing and/or launcher page visually incorporates the generated images.
No backend endpoints are created to fetch these images.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths; compose those components instead.
Authentication must use Internet Identity only (no Microsoft account OAuth or third-party auth).
All user-facing text must be in English.
Do not use Microsoft trademarks, logos, or copyrighted brand assets.
nonGoals: Replicating the real live.com functionality (Outlook/OneDrive integration, real email, file storage, or Microsoft services).
Implementing external OAuth sign-in, email/password auth, or MFA.

required: Abstract airy background illustration with soft shapes (signin-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Minimal set of 8 monochrome line icons for tiles (tile-icons.dim_512x512.png)
Simple neutral brand mark (not Microsoft-like), geometric symbol (app-mark.dim_512x512.png)
